subsection_content:
Symptoms of tonsillitis are inflammation and redness. At a more serious level, the patient finds it difficult to breathe through the mouth. Accordingly, signs of tonsillitis include:
Sorethroat; Tonsils are swollen and red; White or yellow coating appears; Painful blisters or ulcers appear on the throat; Headache; Loss of appetite; Ear hurt; Difficulty swallowing; Swollen lymph nodes in the neck or jaw; Fever and chills; Halitosis; Hard-to-hear or muffled voice; Stiff neck
For children, additional symptoms may appear such as:
Abdominal discomfort; Vomiting; Stomach-ache; Drooling; Anorexic
Considered a common disease in children. In fact, every child can get tonsillitis at least once in their life.
If symptoms last less than 10 days it is called acute tonsillitis. Inflammation that recurs many times a year is considered chronic tonsillitis. (2)
